goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by population?
goals.rationale: This will help us understand the spread of population among state capitals and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between population and latitude of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of population vs latitude
goals.rationale: This will help us identify any correlation between population and latitude of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by elevation?
goals.rationale: This will help us understand the spread of elevation among state capitals and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the relationship between elevation and longitude of state capitals?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of elevation vs longitude
goals.rationale: This will help us identify any correlation between elevation and longitude of state capitals.

goals.question: What is the distribution of state capitals by region?
goals.rationale: This will help us understand the distribution of state capitals across different regions of the US.

code:
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['population'], bins=20)
    plt.xlabel('Population')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by population?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker
import pandas as pd

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['population'], data['latitude'])
    plt.xlabel('Population')
    plt.ylabel('Latitude')
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title("What is the relationship between population and latitude of state capitals?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.hist(data['elevation'], bins=20, edgecolor='black')
    plt.xlabel('Elevation')
    plt.ylabel('Frequency')
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by elevation?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    plt.scatter(data['longitude'], data['elevation'])
    plt.xlabel('Longitude')
    plt.ylabel('Elevation')
    plt.title('What is the relationship between elevation and longitude of state capitals?')
    
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()

import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import matplotlib.ticker as ticker

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    plt.figure(figsize=(6, 6))
    region_counts = data['region'].value_counts()
    region_counts.plot(kind='bar')
    plt.xlabel('Region')
    plt.ylabel('Number of State Capitals')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of state capitals by region?', wrap=True)
    if len(plt.xticks()[0]) > 20:
        plt.gca().xaxis.set_major_locator(ticker.MaxNLocator(20))
    plt.xticks(rotation=45)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
chart.show()
